problem.markdown:
>> In a mass spectrometry the sample under study is (x) is converted to the vapor state before entering the ionization chamber () is converted to liquid state before entering the ionization chamber () is passed through the ionization chamber and is converted to vapor state. () is directly studied in gas , liquid or solid state.
>> Regardless of the method of sample introduction, sample molecules undergo the following before being analyzed or detected: (x) converted to charge particles by ion source () converted to gas or liquid state () repelled by the electric or magnetic field. () keep under vacuum
>> The simplest and the common method of converting a sample to ion is () Filament heating (x) Electron Ionization () Electrospray Ionization () Chemical ionization
>> The energy required to remove an electron from an atom or molecule is () Ionization electron (x) Ionization energy/potential () Electron affinity () Electronegativity
>> The drawback to EI-MS are : () lifetime of some compound fragments are too short to be detected () samples should be relatively volatile () compounds with high molecular weights cannot be measured (x) All the above
>> The mass spectrometry that uses desorption ionization (DI) techniques are: () Secondary ion mass spectroscopy (SIMS) () Fast atom bombardment (FAB) () Matrix-assisted laser desorption ionization (MALDI) (x) All the above
>> Larger and non volatile molecules can be detected using: () EI-MS (x) MALDI () CI-MS () None of the above
>> If a compound has an even number of nitrogen atoms, its molecular ion will appear at an even mass and a compounds with an odd number of nitrogen atoms, the molecular ion will appear at an odd mass. This is called: () Mass rule () Molecular ion rule (x) Nitrogen rule () Mass determination rule
>> To confirm a particular peak corresponds to a molecular ion is done by: () checking for the most intense peak (x) lowering the energy of the beam as a result the intensity of the molecular ion peak will increas () Increasing the amount of the sample taken () Look for the parent peak
>> The presence of which element in a compound is characterized by an odd number of m/z for its parent peak? () Oxygen () Carbon (x) Nitrogen () Hydrogen
problem.p: >> In a mass spectrometry the sample under study is

choicegroup.choice: is converted to the vapor state before entering the ionization chamber
is converted to liquid state before entering the ionization chamber
is passed through the ionization chamber and is converted to vapor state.
is directly studied in gas , liquid or solid state.

problem.p: >> Regardless of the method of sample introduction, sample molecules undergo the following before being analyzed or detected:

converted to gas or liquid state
repelled by the electric or magnetic field.

compounds with high molecular weights cannot be measured

lowering the energy of the beam as a result the intensity of the molecular ion peak will increas
